content.description: Sit start with your choice of edge. From there, climb straight up through edges onto the slab, and reach an easy finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads. A rock makes it slightly uneven.
content.location: It climbs the center of the boulder's west face.

content.description: Start with your choice of hold. From there, climb through generous holds along the crack to reach an easy finish.
content.protection: A pad or two. There is a good landing with one rock that makes it slightly uneven.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's west face.

content.description: Stand start with hands matched on the large jug.  Move up the rock's drainage with some interesting movement.  About halfway up, head out left to avoid the large, loose boulder atop the rock.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter, the landing is good though.
content.location: This is on the West face of Fertile Rock.

content.description:
Sit start at the arete's base with hands on the good crimps.  From there, move up the arete, round the corner, gain the chicken heads, and top it out.

Maintaining contact with a left heel really helps out with this one.
content.protection: A few pads and spot.  There are few benign rocks below the landing, and a pair of trees lie behind the problem.
content.location: This is on the North face of Fertile Rock.

content.description:
Neptunus climbs perfect, incut crimps on a wave-like formation.

Stand start with hands matched on the large undercling.  From there, move up to a thin, left hand crimp, then move to a right hand crimp, bump the left hand over to the sidepull, then stick the decent hold just before the lip (crux), and top it out.
content.protection: A pad or two, but the landing is great.
content.location: This is on the West face of Fertile Rock.

content.description:
Stand start with hands matched on the rail as far right as possible.  From there, traverse left along the rail feature using a thin, right hand crimp, and a left hand sidepull low and left on the face.  At that point, set and fire a left hand into the mail slot at the rail's end.  The remaining topout climbs straight up using the stegasauras-like shaped jugs.

The crux involves a left hand move to the rail's mail slot; this requires a fair amount of accuracy and power.  If used correctly, the right hand crimp can be very strong.
content.protection: A few pads and a spot, there is a large rock directly behind the problem start.
content.location: It is on the West face of Fertile Rock.

content.description: Stand start hands matched on large jug and move out right to a nice rail. From there, move up through a series of tiered jug holds.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter, a large boulder should be noted as topping out goes directly above it.
